newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS - Costello sees positive signs on rates.
newsitem.headline: RTRS - Costello sees positive signs on rates.

text.p: Australian Treasurer Peter Costello said there were positive signs for Australian monetary policy.
"There are positive signs in relation to rates," he told a business dinner.
Earlier on Wednesday, rating agency Standard & Poor's said the fiscal tightening announced in Costello's 1996/97 budget on Tuesday created a positive outlook for Australia's foreign currency debt.
Costello said this was "a very positive statement, directly related to last night's budget."
If Australia's credit rating were to be upgraded, it would "lay a basis for an improvement in interest rates," he said.
S&P earlier affirmed Australia's AA long term foreign currency rating and revised its outlook to positive from stable.

S&P said the package of spending cuts and revenue measures announced by Prime Minister John Howard's Liberal-National government should yield a reduction in the government's underlying budget deficit by 1.8 percent of gross domestic product over the next two years and surpluses in ensuing years.

It said reductions in public sector debt will be boosted further by planned privatisations by the federal and some state governments. "As a result, Standard & Poor's expects the net public external burden to decline to below 70 percent by fiscal year 1998," the ratings agency said.
